oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Civilian Conservation Corps hiking club

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hiking; Walking; Clubs; Staffs (Sticks); Canteens (Beverage containers)
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Four members of a Tennessee Civilian Conservation Corps hiking club are pictured seated on the steps of a building and leaning against the building. They are outfitted for hiking with their walking sticks and canteens. Two members are eating sandwiches.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Spencer & Wyckoff
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Contextual information suggests that this Hiking Club was associated with Civilian Conservation Corps Company 417, located 12 miles southwest of Tellico Plains. Their post office was located at Ivy, Tennessee, and the camp was classified as camp F-14, indicating that theirs was a national forest camp.
